name: GrayBella Capital
description: GrayBella Capital (GBC) is a pan-European VC Fund based in London. GBC specializes in high-growth deep-tech and health-tech companies across the UK and Europe. We invest at Series A and beyond, backing transformative innovations in AI, material science, robotics, medical devices, digital health, AI, diagnostics, and healthcare platforms. We only invest in B2B. We do not invest in consumer tech or therapeutics. We typically serve as a Lead or co-Lead.
investmentAreas: Deep-tech, Health-tech

name: Clearance Venture Partners
description: Clearance Venture Partners is the venture investment arm of Clearance Capital, an investment fund based in London with over 15 years of experience investing in listed real estate. Built World focused UK & Europe Pre-seed and seed stages Typically investing £100k - £300k (with room to go up to £1m if needed) Happy to lead or co-lead deals where appropriate
investmentAreas: Proptech, Contech, Climate

name: Beringea
description: Beringea is a transatlantic venture capital investor that seeks to create lasting success for rapidly scaling entrepreneurial companies. We provide patient and intelligent capital and a global footprint to back entrepreneurs throughout their journey. For U.K. and European entrepreneurs: We'll typically make an initial investment between £1-10 million into companies turning over approximately £1 million or more. We tend to lead Series A or Series B rounds, with further funding available for follow-on investments.
investmentAreas: Advanced Manufacturing, B2B Marketplaces, Clean Technology, Consumer, Healthcare, Media, SaaS

name: Kohli Ventures
description: We back growth-stage ventures in verticals including esports, e-commerce, biotech, artificial intelligence, robotics and technology hardware. We also make private market investments into companies with a clear path toward an imminent IPO.
investmentAreas: E-sports, E-commerce, Biotech, AI, Hardware, Robotics

name: Crista Galli Ventures
description: The healthtech arm of IPQ Capital, the Family Office of Fryland Møller Pathiraja family. We invest in ambitious European healthtech companies at Seed and Series A. Our deep medical expertise, powerful network and agile approach enable founders to build important, world-class healthcare businesses.
investmentAreas: Healthtech, Deeptech, Digital Health, Personalized Healthcare

name: Creator Ventures
description: In March 2022 we closed our first $20m fund, to invest globally in early-stage companies innovating in consumer-internet.
investmentAreas: Consumer Social, Marketplaces, Creator Economy, E-commerce Enablement

name: SHEIN Circularity Fund
description: The flagship initiative of the investment programmme will be the Circularity Fund, to which SHEIN will provide the launch capitalisation of €200 million. Building on SHEIN’s existing programs to advance R&D and innovation in circularity for the fashion industry, the Fund will support start-ups and businesses throughout Europe and the UK that are developing next-generation technologies and solutions by: Investing in early-stage start-ups working on textile-to-textile recycled materials innovation and related areas. Entering into offtake agreements or other commercial partnerships with more mature start-ups with existing production capacity in textile-to-textile recycled materials or new and emerging preferred fibres. SHEIN will be the cornerstone investor of the Circularity Fund and is inviting businesses, financial institutions, sovereign wealth funds globally to co-invest in the Fund.
investmentAreas: New Fibres, Textile, Sustainability, Circular Economy

name: Backfuture VC
description: Backfuture Ventures invests in early-stage SaaS companies, primarily in Europe — and offers them access to SaaStock's big network. They write £100k-200k cheques into pre-seed and seed-stage SaaS companies.
investmentAreas: SaaS

name: JuneX Capital Partners
description: Founded by two childhood friends, Régis Micheli and Benjamin Vedrenne-Cloquet, who turned entrepreneurs and investors, JuneX Capital Partners is a founder-centric investment firm integrating a “Founders Office” and an evergreen investment fund. JuneX’s investment strategy focuses on backing entrepreneurs in the areas of human capital (training, education, employment, health, nutrition, and environment) and investment management (venture capital, private equity, and asset management). Working closely with entrepreneurs, JuneX provides a range of patient and agile capital solutions tailored to founders’ needs. Moreover, in specific situations, it may offer operational and advisory support as an operating or sparring partner. JuneX invests mostly, but not exclusively, in Europe and operates out of the UK and France.
investmentAreas: education, knowledge, skills, health and environment

name: Leadblock Bitpanda Ventures
description: Leadblock Bitpanda Ventures (LBV) is a EU-based investment fund focusing on digital assets start-ups. LBV focuses on the growth drivers underpinning the next crypto cycle: the middleware and application layers, and user-oriented interfaces contributing to Web3's mainstream adoption.
investmentAreas: Web3, Blockchain, Crypto

name: Delin Ventures
description: Delin Ventures is a mission-driven, early-stage investor and company builder specialising in cell therapy, the future of work, and the future of learning.
investmentAreas: Cell therapy (therapeutics, services and manufacturing technologies), HR Tech, Productivity, New Work, Creator & Passion Economy

name: Pioneer Group Life Science Accelerator
description: The Pioneer Group Life Science Accelerator Programme works with entrepreneurs at every stage – from idea to exit. For 20 years, we have supported and invested in founders of cutting-edge life science technologies into visionary ventures, that scale. Helping to transfer ideas (and their founders) out of the lab and into the world.
investmentAreas: Life Sciences, Healthtech, Medtech

name: Ahren Innovation Capital
description: Ahren is a deep tech and deep science investment firm set up by Alice Newcombe-Ellis alongside co-Founding Science Partners. Together, these Founders created companies and/or technologies that are today valued in excess of $100BN combined. The firm was established from first principles with a mission to be disruptive as an investment institution, with a new model – genuine partnership between the creators of deep technology and deep science, and commercially active, long-term capital, to harness tremendous global talent and build and exponentially accelerate the next generation of great enterprises. Ahren’s Portfolio companies include AI21 Labs, Graphcore, Zapata Computing, ZOE, Phaidra, Heirloom Carbon, and Bicycle Therapeutics among others. Ahren has >$800M AUM and has team members in Cambridge (UK), London, and Boston.
investmentAreas: Brain, AI, Efficient Energy, Genetics, Space & Robotics

name: Index Ventures
description: Index Ventures partners with exceptional entrepreneurs – those with unique insight who are intrinsically driven to make their vision a reality. We help them turn their bold ideas into global businesses, and through the companies they build, have a long-lasting and positive impact on the world around us. Index-backed businesses are supported by an experienced team of investors, strategists, and an extensive global network built over three decades of startup investing. Working side-by-side through the scale up journey, we forge deep and long-lasting relationships with founders and their teams. The vast majority of these partnerships begin early in the company’s life, at Seed and Series A, and extend to IPO and beyond. Operating as one team, with feet firmly on both sides of the Atlantic – from London to Tel Aviv, and San Francisco to New York – we are an international team with a global mindset, with experience supporting founders wherever they emerge. When they succeed, they generate returns that in turn support Index’s investors, including non-profit foundations; education, healthcare and research endowments; and other impact-driven organizations.
investmentAreas: SaaS, Fintech, AI, Enterprise Software

name: Noa VC
description: At noa vc (formerly A/O), we’re building Europe’s largest tech fund dedicated to transforming the built world. We believe the built world is more than just physical infrastructure: it is a manifestation of human ingenuity and a reflection of societal values. We call it humanity’s OS. noa invests in pioneering founders and breakthrough technologies that decarbonise the built world. We're backing tech that matters.
investmentAreas: Structures, Energy, Materials, Environments, Mobility, Community

name: UCL Technology Fund
description: The UCL Technology Fund is dedicated to investing in intellectual property commercialisation opportunities arising from UCL’s world-class research base, focusing in particular on the physical and life sciences. The Fund supports UCL in achieving the full potential of innovations that have prospects for outstanding societal and market impact, right through the development journey from initial proof of concept to practical commercial application.
investmentAreas: Life Sciences

name: Blackseed
description: As early-stage investors, our initial funding commitment typically falls within the £100,000 to £400,000 range. We specialise in supporting British tech and tech-enabled businesses with aspirations for global influence. To qualify for our funding, at least one member of the co-founding team must identify as Black. Our primary focus is on backing entrepreneurs who are at the forefront of pioneering innovative solutions for some of the most demanding issues of our time.
investmentAreas: Inclusion, Sector Agnostic

name: Valia Ventures
description: Big ideas don’t scare us — to the contrary, we’re energized by investing early in founders with huge visions. That’s why we start investing at Pre-Seed, Seed, and Series A — and continue to support companies as their ideas shift and grow. Tomorrow’s most iconic companies will defy categorization and create sectors of their own — that’s why we stay open-minded in our approach and are getting behind founding teams building at the edge of more than one category. We’re investing in our portfolio companies across their lifecycle. Our three sequential funds are designed to make Valia a long-term partner to founders as their funding needs expand.
investmentAreas: Healthcare, Robotics, Fintech, Insurance, AI

name: UP VC
description: Early-stage Fintech, DeepTech, and x-Tech investment across the UK, Europe, MNA, and APAC regions. We’re a UK based fund with a genuine curiosity for new challenges that have potential to expand to other continents, having backed founders from diverse backgrounds. Good ideas know no borders. And neither do our investments.
investmentAreas: Fintech, Data, AI, ESGtech, Healthtech, Medtech

name: Martlet Capital
description: Martlet Capital provides early stage patient capital and support. We look to help founders and ventures grow by providing added value beyond money. This may include helping companies build teams and boards, advising on strategy, connections to technical experts, customers and investors, as well as being part of the community of our portfolio companies. We always co-invest alongside others, such as angels, seed funds and VC’s. We usually invest upwards of £250k in a first round and have the capacity to follow on in subsequent investment rounds.
investmentAreas: artificial intelligence and machine learning, digital health and personalised medicine, engineering, internet of things, new materials, quantum technologies, semiconductors, sensing, space technology, sustainable technologies, and wireless communications

name: KHP Ventures
description: The first NHS-founded and backed venture fund for digital health and MedTech. Accelerating the future of healthcare in the UK and beyond.
investmentAreas: Healthtech, Medtech, Digital Health, Life Sciences, Diagnostics

name: Mercuri VC
description: Mercuri is the UK media and entertainment technology venture capital fund. It supports exceptional founders building technology enabled products for the new age of enterprise and the digital lifestyle of consumers in the UK. Mercuri lead funding rounds for start-ups that are impacting the rapidly evolving ecosystem at the intersection of technology, media and entertainment. Mercuri’s second fund, but first multi-LP fund, will focus investment into four specific areas - the creation, distribution, consumption, and monetisation of content and data. Investment targets B2B startups set to enhance the way in which we communicate and engage in a professional and personal context. The fund aims to make six new investments a year. Mercuri is a certified B Corp and the co-founder of VentureESG, and invests in portfolio companies that share its values through a commitment to robust data policies and safe, transparent AI.
investmentAreas: gaming, music, e-sports, design, privacy, education, social, creator economy and communities.

name: Volution Ventures
description: At Volution, we are building a dedicated SaaS and FinTech fund. We seek out ambitious teams that have raised Series A and are ready to accelerate their growth to Series B and beyond. Our team of experienced entrepreneurs, business and investment professionals knows what it takes to build a venture backed business. Our portfolio includes some of the UK’s most exciting SaaS and Fintech companies such as Zopa, Cognism, Signal AI, Brightpearl, Habito, DueDil, RotaGeek, Passfort and Dead Happy. We roll up our sleeves for the founders and CEOs that we partner with, so that together we can grow and succeed, responsibly and sustainably.
investmentAreas: Fintech, SaaS

name: Mouro Capital
description: Mouro Capital is a venture capital firm with $400M assets under managementthat targets early to growth fintech investment opportunities across Europe, North America, and Latin America. The fund brings fintech expertise, a global network and a track-record of successful investments and market recognition from our core investment team to scaling start-ups. Mouro has invested in over 30 companies such as iZettle (acquired by PayPal), Kabbage (acquired by American Express), Creditas, Curve, Ripple, Tradeshift, Trulioo and Upgrade.
investmentAreas: Fintech, Insurtech, Real Estate, Retail

name: The Players Fund
description: Founded by athletes, for athletes. We invest in the next generation of tech enabled startups at Seed & Series A. We implement an investment strategy that harnesses the privileged access to private deals afforded to elite professional athletes. We then add tangible growth by leveraging our network for early-stage companies. We are generalist Seed and Series A investors, writing initial cheques of £50,000 to £300,000 into high-performing early-stage businesses. We focus predominantly on the UK and Europe, but we remain open to exceptional global opportunities. We are not lead investors – instead, we co-invest alongside world-class VCs, collaborating on opportunities with market leading investors and founders.
investmentAreas: Sportstech, Hospitality, Event Industry, Content Creation, Media

name: Pact VC
description: Pact is an early stage tech fund backing mission driven founders with global ambition. We have over 40 years’ experience building purpose driven businesses in Asia, Middle East and India, and a strong track record investing in them in the UK and Europe. Pact invests in pre-seed and seed-stage companies under three themes which we call our ABCs - Access, Betterment, and Climate - Access: democratising access to products and services - Betterment: solutions for personal and professional wellbeing - Climate: technology targeting sustainability and climate solutions
investmentAreas: Climate, Wellbeing, Sustainability

name: Passion Capital
description: Passion Capital is a partnership of entrepreneurs and operators who are applying our experiences to helping founders and early-stage teams build great digital media/technology companies. We are committed to fostering an ecosystem of technology, collaboration and executional excellence in Europe, and we believe that the critical differentiator and key asset of a successful business is the passion and ability of its founders. We take pride in the calibre and success of all of our founders and teams including but nowhere near limited to GoCardless, Tray.io, Mendeley, Digital Shadows, urban, Adzuna, Smarkets, Ravelin, Nested, Tide, Spill, Marshmallow, Butternut Box,, PolyAI, Lendable and Monzo Bank
investmentAreas: Fintech, E-Commerce, Software, AI, ML, Healthtech

name: Pink Salt Ventures
description: We're the UK's first VC firm for female founders. EARLY STAGE INVESTORS IN FEMALE-LED TECHNOLOGY COMPANIES. WE PARTNER WITH THE BEST ENTREPRENEURS AND HELP THEM BUILD LASTING COMPANIES.
investmentAreas: Femtech, Sextech, Wellness, Health

name: SFC Capital
description: SFC Capital (formerly Startup Funding Club) is a leading early-stage investment firm providing capital and support to British startups. By combining our Angel Network and Seed Funds, we have created a unique model that allows investors to get exposure to SEIS- and EIS-qualifying businesses, either directly or through a diversified portfolio curated and managed by our expert team. Recognised by PitchBook Data as the UK's most active VC, our team has supported more than 400 startups to date. Notable SFC Capital portfolio companies include Onfido, Cognism, and Transcend Packaging.
investmentAreas: B2B, B2C, Consumer, Fintech, GreenTech, Hardware, Robotics, Healthtech

name: Infinium Partners
description: Infinium invests in companies at the intersection of the Energy Transition, Efficiency and Mobility. Starting from pre-seed investments from £250k through to Real Asset investments upwards of £25m. We focus on businesses that can deliver strong core unit economics as well as rapid growth.
investmentAreas: Impact Investing, Energy Transition, Efficiency and Mobility

name: Diana NATO Accelerator
description: DIANA is the Defence Innovation Accelerator for the North Atlantic, a NATO organisation with a mission to locate and accelerate dual-use innovation across the Alliance. DIANA provides technology developers with the resources, networks and expertise to address critical defence and security challenges, to create a more peaceful and resilient future.
investmentAreas: DeepTech, Defence, Dual Use, Surveillence, Energy and Power

name: Embryo Ventures
description: Embryo Ventures is a London-based venture firm that backs visionary founders building transformational companies at the seed stage. We place relationships at the fore and are committed to bringing powerful ideas that purposefully challenge current thinking and practice to life.
investmentAreas: Climate, ConTech, Sustainability, Healthcare, Insurance & Mobility

name: Cell VC
description: We work with innovative partners to invest in, accelerate and incubate the most disruptive startups and pioneering founders. Our team of seasoned venture capitalists and operational partners empower smart capital and founders and put their startups on the path of faster and greater growth.
investmentAreas: Agritech, Food & Beverage, Nanotechnology, Software, Marketplaces

name: Unruly Capital
description: Unruly invests in founders that leverage industrial decentralization to create abundance, resilience and freedom - bringing about a more decarbonized, decentralized and developed world.
investmentAreas: Health, Climate, Computing, Agriculture, Transportation

name: AlbionVC
description: AlbionVC supports visionary founders with long-term capital and scale-up expertise. Founded in 1996, today we are partners to UK early-stage software, healthcare and deeptech companies. AlbionVC manages c. $1 billion of venture funds, currently invested in over 50 companies. AlbionVC is the technology investment arm of Albion Capital Group LLP, which is authorised and regulated by the Financial Conduct Authority.
investmentAreas: Climate, Health, Sustainability, AI, Data, Deeptech, Life Sciences

name: Ascension
description: Ascension is an early-stage venture capital firm built and managed by exited operators and entrepreneurs to back the next generation of tech and impact founders. Since 2015, Ascension has invested in 150+ start-ups across its (S)EIS & Institutional Funds – our specialist approach and extensive sector reach allow us to identify and scale pioneering tech enterprises. With over £83m under management and twelve exits, Ascension is the most active VC in London over the past decade (Beauhurst) and is UKBAA's Seed VC of the Year in 2022. Ascension is particularly focused on backing impact businesses leveraging the power of technology to solve some of the world’s biggest problems.
investmentAreas: Impact, DeepTech, E-Commerce, Fintech, Health, New Work, Sustainability

name: Simsan Ventures
description: We are an early-stage diversity VC fund. We back underrepresented founders and diverse teams developing frontier technologies and solving vital issues We seek misprized opportunities. We favour startups generating market-leading returns with scaled impact and dominating the fastest growing global markets. We specialize in catalysing cross-border innovation between Europe and Asia (South Korea, India) for our portfolio companies. We believe in investing in the technology of the future and a better world for all. We prioritize investments in companies with a Deep Tech approach or Fintech solutions in the early stage, from pre-seed to Series A. We are not only a fund but also an institution fostering next generation of emerging VCs and GPs as well as founders. We are one-of-its-kind in Europe providing true change from the top-down and the bottom-up with the initiation of Simsan Academy. Join us during the exciting time of this revolution in VC we are leading!
investmentAreas: Underrepresented Founders, Underinvested sectors, Undervalued Markets

name: Sprints
description: Sprints provides growth capital to category winning, technology enabled companies. We make long-term focused investments in companies that have strong market positions and are managed by excellent teams with a passion to over-deliver to all their stakeholders. We have a long-term partner mindset in everything we do. It influences how we work with our investment partners, our portfolio companies, teams and co-investors. We work closely with our investments to support them in building durable market leading positions.
investmentAreas: Fintech, Marketplaces, SaaS, HRtech, Beauty & Wellness

name: Flight Fund
description: We support founders with our unique ecosystem and a clear mission to bring together the next generation of great entrepreneurs. We seek out those who challenge the status quo, who see opportunities where others see barriers. We're committed to empowering the most innovative minds, providing not just funding, but mentorship, guidance, and a network that fuels their growth.
investmentAreas: Health & Wellbeing, Biotech, Commerce, Tech, Blockchain, Space

name: Notion Capital
description: Notion Capital is a Venture Capital investing firm focused on European SaaS and Cloud, with more than 100 investments to date. We support our exceptional founders on their extraordinary journeys, with life time capital and a value-add platform.
investmentAreas: Cloud Computing, Modern Enterprise, Industry OS, Future Finance

name: Outsized Ventures
description: At Outsized Ventures we partner with founders pushing the boundaries of science and technology to solve the world’s greatest challenges. Some call it deep tech, others frontier tech, tough tech, hard tech or high tech - for us, it is simply the future.
investmentAreas: Biotech, Healthtech, Life Sciences, Pharma, Food and Beverage, Machine Learning, AI

name: Mustard Seed+ Partners
description: Mustard Seed + Partners is a thematic investment firm backing exceptional entrepreneurs who build solutions to address the world’s largest environmental and social challenges. Our vision is to build the leading European impact ecosystem, connecting entrepreneurs with investors, investing with our capital and network to build the businesses of the future.
investmentAreas: SDG 1 - 12

name: Highland Europe
description: We invest in rapidly growing European internet, mobile and software companies that address large market opportunities and have over €10 million in annualized revenues. Our capital enables management teams to accelerate growth and build a lasting, valuable business.
investmentAreas: SaaS, Software, Machine Learning, Retail, Analytics

name: inHealth Ventures
description: InHealth Ventures (IHV) is a London-based early stage venture capital fund investing in tech-enabled healthcare and life sciences. We back founders working to reengineer healthcare, and use our deep experience, strategic insights and global network to accelerate their journey from Seed to Series A and beyond. IHV’s mission is to contribute to bending the healthcare cost curve, improving patient access and outcomes while enhancing the working lives of clinical and non-clinical staff.
investmentAreas: MedTech, Life Sciences, Healthtech

name: Lightrock
description: Lightrock is a global investment platform dedicated to building a sustainable future. Headquartered in London, Lightrock manages capital across both public and private markets, a significant portion of which is dedicated to climate innovation.
investmentAreas: Smart Mobility, Infrastructure Tech, Fintech, Renewables, Sustainable Food & Agriculture, Healthtech

name: Localglobe
description: We've seeded impactful founders since 1999 at places like Citymapper, Improbable, Lovefilm, Moo, Wise and Zoopla. London's just getting started.
investmentAreas: Fintech, E-Commerce, SaaS, Software, AI, Machine Learning

name: Expansion Capital
description: We invest in early stage technology companies. Neil, Rishi and Dan met at Revolut as early employees and launched Expansion Capital in 2020 to deploy capital into early stage companies.
investmentAreas: Fintech, Travel Tech, Software, Sustainability, B2B, marketplaces, AI

name: FPE Capital
description: We are investors in the second-stage growth of software, data, and software services companies. We invest in profitable UK/Irish headquartered companies with revenues of £5m to £50m which have the ability to accelerate their growth. Our singular focus on a select group of software companies, many of which have received minimal or no external capital to date, drives our success through focus. By concentrating our efforts and resources, we consistently and successfully identify, fund, scale, and support companies as they navigate the next stage of their journey. This transformative phase, which we call second-stage growth, involves a renewed emphasis on investing in people, products, and processes. We are a highly experienced team that brings together entrepreneurial, operational and private equity experience to help our companies realise their potential. A strong partner, we provide capital, expertise and a wide network of connections together with the experience and energy to drive exceptional growth in large markets across diverse geographies.
investmentAreas: Software, Software Services, Data

name: Edge
description: Edge are specialist investors in exceptional creative teams and emerging technologies. Our long-established network of highly experienced executives and senior specialists is formalised through our Leadership Council of world-class sector experts. We leverage the collective networks of our Board, our Advisers, and our Investment Team, our relationships span far beyond what you see here – all of whom we know directly as potential co-investors and corporations that are willing to work with us or the teams that we back. Creativity at its core is about imagination and novelty. We look for random drivers of creativity in the social and cultural spheres. Companies increasing access to creativity and companies supplying these creative companies, like software, are the type of companies we back. Consumers around the world are spending more and more on the creative sectors, even during recessions as consumers shift from ownership to experiences. Technology continues to widen those who can participate in creativity. With our market expertise, we will find those emerging technologies and accelerate them to become the industry champions of the future.
investmentAreas: Music, AI, Software, Adtech, Edtech

name: Entreé Capital
description: We are a global venture capital firm founded in 2010. We manage over $1.25 billion across nine funds, with offices in Tel Aviv, London and New York. We believe in exceptional founders and invest in a wide range of sectors including AI, Data, DeepTech, FinTech, Cyber, SaaS, and Crypto, providing support to innovative startups from pre-seed to growth stages. In our portfolio you can find more than 180 high-profile companies, including monday.com, Riskified, Rapyd, Coupang, HiBob, Gusto, Talon Cyber, Breezometer, Glovo, Bluewhite Robotics, Stripe, NVision, Stash, Mesh Payments, Perimeter81, PillPack, and many more. Over the yeras, we exited or IPO’d over 33 companies, with significant IPO’s including Deliveroo, Coupang, Riskified, monday.com, Talon Cyber and Perimeter 81.
investmentAreas: Crypto & Blockchain Cybersecurity DeepTech DevOps & Data E-Commerce & Consumer Tech FinTech & InsurTech FoodTech & AgTech Games & Social Health & Life Sciences Logistics & Industry 4.0 PropTech SaaS
fundingStage: Pre-Seed / Seed, Series A/B, Series C & Beyond

name: DN Capital
description: DN Capital is a global early stage and growth capital investor focused on Seed, Series A and select series B investments in fintech, SaaS, digital media, e-commerce, marketplaces, mobile applications and software companies. The firm was founded in 2000 and has operations in London, Berlin and Silicon Valley. DN Capital’s previous funds are top performers and the firm is one of the lead investors in companies such as Endeca (sold to Oracle), Shazam (one of the world’s leading mobile app), Auto1 (world's largest used car marketplaces), Purplebricks (IPO London) and Quandoo (sold to Recruit). The professionals at DN Capital bring over 75 years of private equity experience to their investments, and actively work with portfolio companies to steward their growth through the various stages of development.
investmentAreas: SaaS, E-Commerce, Fintech

name: ETF Partners
description: Founded in 2006, ETF Partners (The Environmental Technologies Fund) stands as Europe's original venture capital firm dedicated to sustainability and impact investing. The fund invests in fast-growing innovative companies across Europe that deliver positive environmental impact. The fund is supported by the European Investment Fund and British Patient Capital.
investmentAreas: Climate Tech, Sustainability, Impact Investing

name: Circularity Capital
description: Circularity Capital was founded as an independent investment manager in 2015, with a mission to deliver value for investors by supporting growth and innovation in the circular economy. We are a supportive hands-on investor and use our team’s specialist expertise and knowledge in the circular economy to support the businesses we back. Circularity’s investors comprise of pension funds, fund of funds, insurance companies and leading single family offices.
investmentAreas: Sustainability, Food, Retail, Circular Models, Circular Materials, Enabling Solutions

name: Climate VC
description: We are on the lookout to support and fund early-stage UK-based climate startups. We make sure to invest in the long term, providing space and opportunity for the people at the forefront of innovation. Potential Climate Ventures F1 Limited (PCV) is an appointed representative of SFC Capital Partners Ltd which is authorised and regulated by the Financial Conduct Authority (‘FCA’) in the United Kingdom (FRN 736284)
investmentAreas: Sustainability, Climate, Food, Carbon Removals, Green Finance

name: Adjuvo
description: Adjuvo is an experienced membership network of Angel investors who support and commit capital to innovative early-stage British companies. From former Directors of large public companies to successful founders and entrepreneurs, our membership consists of over 170 individuals with expertise across private and public industry sectors and organisations of scale. With a portfolio of over 20 businesses, potential portfolio companies will be innovative, high-growth businesses led by outstanding founders who have the desire to work collaboratively with us and other co-investors.
investmentAreas: Mobility, Rental Platforms, Sharing Economy, Life Science, AI, Marketing

name: Anamcara
description: Anamcara is a pre-/seed stage fund investing angel-size checks in B2B companies across Europe. We are reimagining the future of commerce by investing in companies that are leading the new wave of business technologies. Anamcara means ‘soul friend’, a person with who can share anything with without judgment. Our mission is to find the best founders and to build meaningful partnerships to help them achieve greatness.
investmentAreas: SaaS, B2B, Blockchain, AI, Fintech

name: BGF
description: BGF is the most active equity investor in the UK and Ireland. We have a unique proposition that few investment partners can match. We provide businesses with an initial investment of £1m-£20m, with significant follow-on funding available for new growth opportunities. This investment is intended to help you scale-up through ambitious growth plans, such as product development, international expansion, M&A or succession planning. Our Growth team is located across 15 offices in the UK and Ireland.
investmentAreas: Climate, Sustainability. Deep Tech, Life Sciences
fundingStage: Pre-Seed / Seed, Series A/B, Series C & Beyond

name: Backed VC
description: BACKED is the human-centric venture capital fund. We invest in exceptional founders, at Seed, in Europe. We provide founders with an extensive support system to catalyse their development as a company operators and leaders. Through our Founder Experience Platform and energetic portfolio community we help entrepreneurs across all areas of a startup: from talent management to business development, further fundraising and international expansion. Founded in 2015 by partners Andre de Haes and Alex Brunicki, we invest across sectors including BioTech, Financial Services, Blockchain, Advanced Manufacturing and more. Over 80+ investments to date include Hutch (acquired), Thought Machine, Amenitiz, LabGenius, THIS, Enterprise Alumni, and many more.
investmentAreas: Biotech, Fintech, Blockchain, Manufacturing

name: 20VC
description: 20VC is the fund of Harry Stebbings, a well-known podcaster behind "20 minute VC" podcast. The funds, one focused on early-stage investments and the other on growth-stage opportunities, attracted LPs such as MIT, early Spotify investor Shakil Khan, and RIT Capital Partners. This marks a significant increase from Stebbings' first $8.3 million fund launched less than a year ago. His 20VC portfolio already includes unicorns like Clubhouse and Hopin, highlighting his success as a 24-year-old venture capitalist in a rapidly evolving tech landscape.
investmentAreas: web3, digital health, HRtech, AI, KYC, ML

name: 83North
description: 83North is a global venture capital firm with more than $2B under management that invests in European and Israeli entrepreneurs creating global businesses. In their 18 years of operation they’ve invested in 89 companies, exited 32 of them and have been fortunate to be involved with 14 unicorns.
investmentAreas: Fintech, Mobility, Healthtech, Marketplaces, SaaS, Security

name: ACF Investors

name: RTP Global

Since then, that same bold, ambitious spirit has defined us at RTP Global. It's the very essence we look for in founders. We believe in true potential and act decisively, investing early and committing deeply. Our approach often spans long-term relationships, with investments sometimes lasting up to 20 years as we support founders in realizing their ambitions. When our bets pay off, we reinvest the proceeds into new funds, demonstrating our commitment to continuous support and growth. As early-stage investors and former founders ourselves, alongside startup operators, engineers, and data scientists, we bring diverse perspectives to every decision. Twice a week, our global teams in New York, Bangalore, Dubai, London, and Paris come together to leverage their local knowledge, discuss trends, and make informed decisions. This collaboration extends not only across our team but also to our exclusive network of entrepreneurs, providing our founders with unparalleled access to diverse insights and opportunities. Embracing variety and diversity, we understand that groundbreaking ideas arise from thinking differently. At RTP Global, we foster an environment where founders can connect, share ideas, and forge lasting connections, because we believe in the power of diverse perspectives to shape the future.

name: Nauta Capital
description: Nauta Capital, accessible through nautacapital.com, is a leading venture capital firm specializing in early-stage B2B software investments. With offices in London and Barcelona, our focus is on supporting entrepreneurs who are reshaping traditional industries with innovative technologies and business models. We manage over €500 million in assets and have built a strong track record of identifying and nurturing high-growth startups across Europe. Our investments span key sectors such as Software as a Service (SaaS), AI/ML & Data, HRtech, Fintech, Retail Tech, Health Tech, Productivity Tool, Dev Tools & Infra, G2M & Customer. Our approach is hands-on. We provide strategic guidance and operational support to our portfolio companies, helping them scale rapidly and navigate global markets effectively. This collaborative effort enables entrepreneurs to capitalize on growth opportunities and achieve their full potential. Nauta has led investments in more than 80 companies including Brandwatch, Lodgify, Mercaux, Holded, MishiPay, Landbot, AppFollow, ifeel and Cledara. This illustrates our commitment to backing visionary founders and disruptive technologies. As we continue to play a pivotal role in the venture capital landscape, we actively seek innovative startups poised for substantial growth and impact.
investmentAreas: B2B, Software, SaaS

Our team, rich in PhD expertise, has achieved over 20 successful exits to date, including acquisitions by industry giants like Oracle, Google, Apple, Facebook, Siemens, and various IPOs. Our investments typically range from £0.5m to £10m in disruptive Deep Tech companies across various sectors such as generative AI, advanced engineering, novel materials, space-tech, quantum hardware and algorithms, cyber and data security, and synthetic biology. Our focus areas include HealthTech, FoodTech, and Financial Health, primarily within the UK/EU region while opportunistically exploring opportunities globally. Our founders, Matt Cooper and Paolo Pio, bring a wealth of experience to Exceptional Ventures. Matt's background includes co-founding Capital One Bank in the US, Tandem Bank in the UK, and chairing Octopus Group for over two decades. Paolo, formerly a Silicon Valley Software Engineer and Tech Executive, transitioned into venture capital as MD Europe at Joyance Partners, a prominent US HealthTech VC fund. With $400 million in Assets under Management (AuM), the fund focuses on early to growth stage investment opportunities across Europe, North America, and Latin America. Mouro Capital brings deep fintech expertise, a global network, and a track record of successful investments to scaling startups. The firm has invested in over 30 companies, including notable successes like iZettle (acquired by PayPal), Kabbage (acquired by American Express), Creditas, Curve, Ripple, Tradeshift, Trulioo, and Upgrade. Mouro Capital's mission is to support innovative companies driving transformation in the financial services industry through strategic investments and operational support.
investmentAreas: Fintech, Proptech, Insurtech, Regtech
fundingStage: Pre-Seed / Seed, Series A/B, Series C & Beyond

name: SCVC
description: SCVC (Science Creates Venture Capital) specializes in investing in advanced technologies ranging from biotech to quantum tech. They partner with companies that share their mission of enhancing global health and sustainability. As a team of deep tech enthusiasts and serial entrepreneurs, SCVC supports like-minded founders who are driven to make a significant impact. Operating as the official VC arm of Science Creates, SCVC provides access to a specialized ecosystem encompassing incubators, investment opportunities, strategic partnerships, and tailored programs tailored for deep tech startups. Their focus is on nurturing innovation and accelerating the growth of technologies that address critical global challenges.
investmentAreas: Biotechnology, Financial Services, Health Care, Incubators, Industrial, Internet, Life Science, Medical, Venture Capital

Based on their strategic approach, Walking Ventures identifies promising startups and provides seed capital to support their initial growth phases. The fund focuses on sectors such as digital technology, software-as-a-service (SaaS), e-commerce, and innovative internet-based solutions. Walking Ventures not only offers financial support but also provides strategic guidance and operational expertise to help startups accelerate their development and achieve market traction. By leveraging their network and industry insights, Walking Ventures aims to empower entrepreneurial teams to innovate and disrupt their respective markets. For startups seeking early-stage funding and strategic partnership, Walking Ventures offers a valuable platform to fuel growth and scale their businesses. For more details about their investment criteria and portfolio, visit their official website.
investmentAreas: Internet Startups, Mobile Startups, Early-Stage Companies, Big Market Opportunities, Strong Teams

name: Begin Capital
description: Begin Capital is an international venture capital fund specializing in (Pre) Seed and Series A investments in startups globally, with a primary focus on Europe. Our mission is to identify and support early-stage ventures poised for growth and innovation. By leveraging our extensive network and expertise, we empower entrepreneurs to scale their businesses and achieve market leadership. Begin Capital's strategic investments aim to drive technological advancements and create lasting value in the evolving startup ecosystem.
investmentAreas: B2B, Cloud Infrastructure, Cyber Security, Database, Education, FinTech, Marketplace

name: Inference Partners
description: Inference Partners is a thesis-driven venture capital firm specializing in the future of infrastructure software. We prioritize building trusted, long-lasting relationships with entrepreneurs, deeply engaging with each company we partner with. Our philosophy embraces a long-term view, respecting the challenges and risks entrepreneurs face, and offering supportive partnership through both prosperous and challenging times. We challenge conventional wisdom, analyzing each situation from diverse perspectives rather than guessing, to take informed risks. Our investment focus is early-stage, typically investing at pre-seed or seed stages, and we aim to contribute meaningfully throughout the company's growth journey. In terms of sectors, we exclusively invest in enterprise and infrastructure software companies, focusing on areas such as data management, computing technologies, networking solutions, digital payments, and cybersecurity. We seek teams with deep domain expertise and unique perspectives to innovate and address significant customer needs effectively.
investmentAreas: Artificial Intelligence, Data Analytics, Machine Learning, Enterprise Software

name: Creator Fund
description: Creator Fund is a venture capital firm at the forefront of innovation, investing in startups pushing the boundaries of what's possible. Specializing in deep technology businesses emerging from university innovation, we particularly support PhD and academic founders. With teams strategically located across 28 university campuses, we identify and nurture exceptional talent. Our portfolio includes visionary founders developing revolutionary technologies such as mutation-proof vaccines, electronic skin for robots, and mind-machine interfaces. We invest at the pre-seed and seed stages, actively collaborating with our portfolio companies to scale and secure subsequent funding rounds. Backed by prominent funds across Europe and the US, Creator Fund is committed to advancing groundbreaking innovations that shape the future.
investmentAreas: Content creation tools, Creator economy platforms, Digital media, Social commerce

name: Form Ventures
description: Form Ventures is an early-stage venture fund specializing in investments in startups that disrupt regulated markets or pioneer new markets likely to face regulation. The firm focuses on sectors where innovation intersects with regulatory challenges, aiming to drive industry transformation and market leadership. For entrepreneurs seeking investment and regulatory expertise, Form Ventures offers a platform to scale their businesses while addressing regulatory complexities. To learn more about pitching opportunities, visit formventures.vc/pitch for detailed information.
